div.p: The Huntington Park Farmers’ Market is open every Wednesday from 9:30am – 1:30pm. There is a combination of seasonal produce and Mexican food vendors. The Harbor Area Farmers’ Markets organizes the market in Huntington Park and aims to help working class communities purchase directly from small family farmers. This helps reduce costs for both the farmer and the buyer. Especially for lower income residents, the farmers’ market is a good place to buy fresh produce that would otherwise be more expensive or hard to find in a conventional supermarket. The market uses the Salt Lake Park, which also has a skate park, tennis courts, a soccer field, and other recreational facilities. This strategic location of the farmers’ market means that it can also function as a community gathering place in one of the few green spaces in Huntington Park.

note.p: Huntington Park’s Farmers’ Market aims to bring fresh produce to underserved communities. It also acts a community gathering place at Salt Lake Park.
